summary: This is a series of internal Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) notes from July 28, 2019, documenting Jeffrey Epstein's medical complaints and psychological status while in custody. It details his reports of numbness, sleep issues, and his resistance to returning to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with staff determining he is psychologically stable and planning his transfer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the document, complaining of physical symptoms (numbness in arm and neck, sleep issues) and expressing a desire to remain in a safer area of the facility rather than return to the SHU.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Listed as a cellmate assignment (#20472-038) for Epstein in the SHU, indicating planned housing arrangements.

connections.description: Document indicates Epstein was to be placed in the SHU with Lopez as a cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints and SHU Transfer Planning
events.description: Epstein reports numbness in his right arm and neck, inability to sleep, and a running toilet in his cell. Medical staff assess him. Prison administrators plan his transfer from psychological observation back to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was in custody at the MCC in New York and was on psychological observation.
Epstein complained of significant physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and cited sleep apnea as potentially impairing his memory.
Prison staff determined Epstein was 'psychologically stable' and planned to move him from observation to the SHU with a cellmate named Lopez.
Epinson expressed a desire to remain in a safer area of the prison ('down here') rather than return to the SHU, but his request was denied for non-medical reasons.
